item.title: 以下是苹果公司在 WWDC 上发布的所有信息
item.description: 苹果公司周一发布了包括 iPhone 在内的一系列人工智能功能和软件增强版，希望借此刺激下滑的销售。【原文：Apple on Monday unveiled a range of AI-enabled features and software enhancements for its devices, including the iPhone, in a bid to bolster sagging sales.】

item.title: 加州在大石油公司气候诉讼案中追讨公司利润
item.description: 加利福尼亚州总检察长周一寻求迫使全球最大的石油公司放弃利润，该州称这些公司在欺骗消费者他们在造成气候变化方面的作用时赚取了利润。【原文：California's attorney general on Monday sought to force the world's biggest oil companies to give up profits the state alleges they made while deceiving consumers about their role in contributing to climate change.】

item.title: 埃隆-马斯克称，如果苹果将操作系统与 OpenAI 整合，他将禁用苹果设备
item.description: 埃隆-马斯克（Elon Musk）周一表示，如果 iPhone 制造商在操作系统层面整合 OpenAI，他将禁止其公司使用苹果设备。【原文：Elon Musk said on Monday he would ban Apple devices at his companies if the iPhone maker integrates OpenAI at the OS level.】

item.title: UAW 总裁面临独立监督员的调查
item.description: 根据周一的一份法庭文件，美国汽车工人联合会主席肖恩-费恩（Shawn Fain）正接受一名独立联邦监督员的调查，该监督员被指控对其他工会领导人进行报复。【原文：United Auto Workers President Shawn Fain is under investigation by an independent federal monitor over allegations of retaliation against other union leaders, according to a court filing on Monday.】

item.title: 独家消息：消息人士称，阿波罗和 Kyndryl 正在竞购 DXC Technology
item.description: 熟悉内情的人士周一表示，收购公司 Apollo Global 和从 IBM 分离出来的信息技术服务提供商 Kyndryl Holdings 正在就联合竞购 DXC Technology 进行谈判。【原文：Buyout firm Apollo Global and Kyndryl Holdings , the information technology services provider that was spun out of IBM , are in talks about a joint bid for DXC Technology , people familiar with the matter said on Monday.】

item.title: 文件显示，美国证券交易委员会要求纽约市广播公司在代理声明中披露更多信息
item.description: 纽约社区银行周一提交的监管文件显示，美国证券交易委员会 4 月份曾要求该公司在其初步代理声明中披露更多信息。【原文：The U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission in April had sought additional disclosures from New York Community Bancorp in its preliminary proxy statement, regulatory filings made by the regional lender showed on Monday.】

item.title: 巴西航空工业公司 "夏娃 "计划最快于 7 月为飞行出租车认证筹集资金
item.description: 电动飞机制造商伊夫（Eve）首席执行官约翰-博尔戴斯（Johann Bordais）告诉路透社记者，伊夫预计最早将在下个月筹集资金，为其飞行出租车在2026年获得认证前的运营提供资金支持。【原文：Electric aircraft maker Eve expects to raise funds as early as next month to finance operations through the certification of its flying taxi in 2026, Chief Executive Johann Bordais told Reuters.】

item.title: 苹果将使用自己的服务器芯片实现人工智能功能
item.description: 苹果公司在周一举行的年度开发者大会上表示，将使用自己的服务器芯片为其设备上的人工智能功能提供支持。【原文：Apple will use its own server chips to help power artificial intelligence features on its devices, the company said at its annual developer conference on Monday.】

item.title: 以色列媒体报道：英特尔停止 250 亿美元的以色列工厂扩建计划
item.description: 据以色列财经新闻网站 Calcalist 周一报道，英特尔公司已决定停止价值 250 亿美元的以色列工厂扩建计划。【原文：Intel Corp has decided to halt a $25 billion expansion of its factories in Israel, Israeli financial news website Calcalist reported on Monday.】

item.title: 贝莱德在大选前对长期美国国债持谨慎态度
item.description: 贝莱德投资研究所（BlackRock Investment Institute）周一表示，在 11 月总统大选之前，该机构对长期美国国债持谨慎态度，因为由于财政赤字庞大，投资者可能会要求更多的补偿来持有这些国债。【原文：The BlackRock Investment Institute said on Monday it was cautious on long-term U.S. Treasuries ahead of the November presidential elections as investors will likely ask for more compensation to hold them because of wide fiscal deficits.】

item.title: OpenAI 聘请 Nextdoor 前首席执行官 Sarah Friar 担任首任首席财务官
item.description: OpenAI 周一表示，已聘请社交媒体公司 Nextdoor 的前首席执行官 Sarah Friar 担任首任首席财务官。【原文：OpenAI said on Monday it had hired Sarah Friar, the former CEO of social media firm Nextdoor , as its first chief financial officer.】

item.title: GameStop 连续第二日暴跌，因为备忘录股票涨势减弱
item.description: GameStop 股价周一连续第二个交易日暴跌，在股票影响者基思-吉尔（Keith Gill）上周重返 YouTube 后，未能激发投资者对这家陷入困境的购物中心零售商的新热情，股价跌幅扩大。【原文：Shares of GameStop tumbled for a second consecutive session on Monday, extending deep losses after stock influencer Keith Gill's return to YouTube last week failed to spark fresh investor enthusiasm for the struggling shopping mall retailer.】

item.title: 优步（Uber）在美国上诉法院输掉了对加州临时工法律的挑战
item.description: 周一，美国一家上诉法院驳回了优步（Uber）及其子公司 Postmates 要求重启对加州一项法律的挑战，该法律可能会迫使这些公司将司机视为雇员，而不是通常成本较低的独立承包商。【原文：A U.S. appeals court on Monday rejected a bid by Uber and subsidiary Postmates to revive a challenge to a California law that could force the companies to treat drivers as employees rather than independent contractors who are typically less expensive.】

item.title: 摩根士丹利首席执行官称人工智能可为金融顾问每周节省 10 到 15 个小时的时间
item.description: 摩根士丹利首席执行官泰德-皮克（Ted Pick）在周一的一次会议上告诉投资者，人工智能的使用可以为摩根士丹利的财务顾问每周节省 10 到 15 个小时。【原文：The use of artificial intelligence could save Morgan Stanley's financial advisers between 10 to 15 hours a week, the bank's CEO Ted Pick told investors at a conference on Monday.】

item.title: 罗杰斯通信公司与 NBC 环球公司和华纳兄弟发现公司签署内容协议
item.description: 电信巨头罗杰斯通信公司（Rogers Communications）周一表示，该公司已与 Comcast 旗下的 NBCUniversal 和 Warner Bros Discover 达成多年期协议，将体育和娱乐内容引入加拿大。【原文：Rogers Communications has entered into multi-year deals with Comcast-owned NBCUniversal and Warner Bros Discover to bring sports and entertainment content to Canada, the telecom giant said on Monday.】

item.title: 拉加德称欧洲央行可能在两次降息之间等待数次会议
item.description: 欧洲央行行长克里斯蒂娜-拉加德（Christine Lagarde）在接受报纸采访时表示，欧洲央行的利率并非直线下降，决策者有时可能会等待不止一次会议后才再次降息。【原文：European Central Bank interest rates are not on a linear downwards path and policymakers could at times wait more than one meeting before cutting them again, ECB President Christine Lagarde said in a newspaper interview.】

item.title: 美联储面临通胀难题，长期国债持有量减少
item.description: 在美联储本周召开为期两天的货币政策会议之前，债券投资者因担心通胀持续高企而减少了对期限较长的美国国债的投资。【原文：Bond investors, worried about persistently sticky inflation, have reduced their exposure to longer-dated U.S. Treasuries ahead of the Federal Reserve's two-day monetary policy meeting this week in which it is likely to hold interest rates steady.】

item.title: 欧盟大选结果和极右翼势力激增对市场意味着什么？
item.description: 极右翼势力在欧洲议会选举中获胜，促使法国总统埃马纽埃尔-马克龙（Emmanuel Macron）召集了一次震撼性的全国投票，这使欧洲的政治风险再次成为焦点，而金融市场长期以来一直将这些风险置于次要地位。【原文：Gains for the far-right in European Parliament elections that prompted French President Emmanuel Macron to call a shock national vote puts the focus squarely back on political risks in Europe that financial markets had long put on the backburner.】

item.title: 据《华尔街日报》报道，埃德加-布朗夫曼希望以超过 20 亿美元的价格收购派拉蒙公司的所有者 National Amusements
item.description: 据《华尔街日报》周一报道，前媒体高管埃德加-布朗夫曼（Edgar Bronfman）在私募股权公司贝恩资本（Bain Capital）的支持下，已表示有兴趣以 20 亿至 25 亿美元的价格收购派拉蒙的控制公司 National Amusements。【原文：Former media executive Edgar Bronfman, backed by private equity firm Bain Capital, has expressed interest in buying National Amusements, which controls Paramount , for between $2 billion and $2.5 billion, the Wall Street Journal reported on Monday.】

item.title: 据 CNBC 报道，CalSTRS 将投票反对特斯拉首席执行官马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案
item.description: 加利福尼亚州教师退休系统（CalSTRS）首席投资官周一告诉 CNBC，该退休基金将投票反对特斯拉首席执行官埃隆-马斯克 560 亿美元的薪酬方案。【原文：California State Teachers Retirement System (CalSTRS) will vote against Tesla CEO Elon Musk's $56 billion pay package, the pension fund's chief investment officer told CNBC on Monday.】

item.title: 备忘录称摩根大通新聘首席技术官
item.description: 摩根大通在周一的一份备忘录中表示，该行聘请了前 PayPal 高管斯里-希瓦南达（Sri Shivananda）担任新的首席技术官（CTO），这是摩根大通最近一次聘请高级人才，负责部署其 170 亿美元的部分技术预算。【原文：JPMorgan Chase hired former PayPal executive Sri Shivananda as its new chief technology officer (CTO), the bank said in a memo on Monday, the latest senior hire tasked with deploying some of its $17 billion tech budget.】

item.title: 纽约联储调查发现，5 月份对未来通胀路径的看法不一
item.description: 纽约联邦储备银行周一发布的一份报告显示，5月份美国公众对未来通胀路径的展望喜忧参半。【原文：The U.S. public’s outlook on the future path of inflation was mixed in May, according to a report on Monday from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.】

item.title: 墨西哥投资者担心一边倒的投票可能威胁法治
item.description: 墨西哥执政党上周出人意料地取得了一边倒的胜利，这让投资者担心，该党可能会利用其职权，将长期以来一直让商界感到欣慰的对总统权力的一些制衡措施撇在一边。【原文：The Mexican governing party's unexpectedly lopsided victory last week has investors concerned that it may use its mandate to sweep aside some of the checks on presidential power which have long been a source of comfort to the business community.】

item.title: UAW 与 Ultium Cells 达成临时协议
item.description: 联合汽车工人工会周一表示，已与俄亥俄州洛兹敦的 Ultium Cells 公司达成临时合同协议。【原文：The United Auto Workers union said on Monday it reached a tentative contract agreement with Ultium Cells in Lordstown, Ohio, where workers build electric vehicle batteries for General Motors .】

item.title: 美国参议院小组扩大对宝马使用被禁中国供应商零部件的调查范围
item.description: 参议院财政委员会主席周一表示，他将扩大对德国汽车制造商宝马使用一家被禁中国供应商的电子元件的调查。【原文：The chair of the Senate Finance Committee on Monday said he was expanding its probe into German automaker BMW's use of electronic components from a banned Chinese supplier.】

item.title: 美国最高法院驳回克罗格对 Grubhub 商标胜诉的质疑
item.description: 美国最高法院周一拒绝考虑连锁超市克罗格（Kroger）的请求，即阻止 Grubhub 使用食品配送公司的叉刀标志，理由是该标志会与克罗格餐包服务公司 Home Chef 的标志产生混淆。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court declined on Monday to consider supermarket chain Kroger's request to block Grubhub's use of the food-delivery company's fork-and-knife logo based on allegations that it would cause confusion with the Kroger meal-kit service Home Chef's logo.】

item.title: 路威酩轩集团旗下公司因剥削劳工被意大利法院接管
item.description: 法国奢侈品巨头路威酩轩集团（LVMH）旗下一家生产迪奥（Dior）品牌手袋的意大利子公司被指控将工作分包给虐待工人的中国公司。【原文：An Italian subsidiary of French luxury giant LVMH that makes Dior-branded handbags was placed under court administration on Monday, after a probe alleged it had sub-contracted work to Chinese firms that mistreated workers.】

item.title: 美国最高法院将审理 Facebook 要求撤销股东诉讼的请求
item.description: 美国最高法院周一同意审理 Meta 旗下脸书公司（Facebook）提出的一项请求，以阻止一项私人证券欺诈诉讼，该诉讼指控该社交媒体平台在 2017 年和 2018 年误导投资者，称该公司和第三方滥用其用户数据。【原文：The U.S. Supreme Court agreed on Monday to hear a bid by Meta's Facebook to scuttle a private securities fraud lawsuit accusing the social media platform of misleading investors in 2017 and 2018 about the misuse of its user data by the company and third parties.】

item.title: 巴西五月通胀数据将加速
item.description: 据路透社周一公布的一项民意调查显示，巴西 5 月份的消费者物价数据可能会显示通胀加速，反映出近期南部灾难性洪灾造成的损失。【原文：Brazil's consumer price data for May will likely show an acceleration in inflation, reflecting the damage from recent disastrous floods in the south, according to a Reuters poll published on Monday.】

item.title: 英伟达分拆股票后可能被纳入道琼斯指数引发热议
item.description: 英伟达（Nvidia）旨在吸引散户投资者的 10 拆 1 股票拆细计划已经生效，这引发了人们对这家人工智能领军企业被纳入蓝筹股道指的可能性的猜测。【原文：Nvidia's 10-for-1 stock split aimed at luring retail investors has taken effect, sparking speculation over chances of the artificial intelligence bellwether's inclusion in the blue-chip Dow index.】
